revised_title: Rigorous Lower-Bound Procedure for Electric Polarizabilities of Two-Electron Atoms
tldr: The authors developed a method to calculate rigorous lower bounds for electric polarizabilities and other second-order properties of two-electron atoms, even when the field-free problem cannot be solved exactly. They applied this method to calculate dipole polarizabilities for low-lying singlet and triplet states of helium and other two-electron ions using well-correlated variational trial functions. The calculated values provide high-accuracy estimates and help evaluate the leading unknown terms in the expansion of the polarizability.
